Description.val:
This program provides for procurement of AN/SPQ-9B Radars whose primary mission is to detect and track low flying Anti-Ship Missile targets in heavy clutter.  The mission of the AN/SPQ-9B has been expanded to include the capability to detect and classify periscopes. The Periscope Detection and Discrimination (PDD) capability has been designed and incorporated to operate concurrently with the Anti-Ship Missile Defense (ASMD) capability.

[BR5IN AN/SPQ-9B FMP INSTALLATIONS]: AN/SPQ-9B systems are installed using Alteration Installation Teams (AITs) that customarily require funding for planning yard Design Services Allocation (DSA) up to two years prior to the year of installation and funding for Advanced Planning (AP) one year prior to installation, to support individual ship class drawing packages, ship checks and long lead material unique to the installation in order to maintain alignment with ship availability schedules. 

[BR6IN AN/SPQ-9B NON FMP INSTALLATIONS]: Provided funding for the installation of equipment for Land Based Test Sites (LBTS).

[P40A / BR040 TRANSMITTER UPGRADE FMP]: Funding was provided for installations of AN/SPQ-9B Transmitter Upgrades on LPD-17.

[P40A / BR040 TRANSMITTER UPGRADE NON-FMP EQUIPMENT]: Funding provided for Transmitter Upgrade Processor installations at Surface Warfare Engineering Facility (SWEF) and Combat Systems Engineering Development Site (CSEDS) (both non-FMP).

[P40A / BR042 AN/SPQ-9B ENGINEERING CHANGE PROPOSALS (ECP)]: Procures product improvements generated by Engineering Change Proposals (ECPs); corrects problems reported by Fleet units; upgrades unreliable components and replaces obsolete components and parts no longer in production for AN/SPQ-9B Radar; and addresses supportability concerns.  Purchases and installs ECPs, including Antenna Shock Upgrade Kits, Antenna Radar Components, Digital Signal Processor (DSP) Kits, Periscope Detection and Discrimination (PDD) Kits and engineering change kit hardware components.  Antenna Shock Upgrade Kits are installed during Antenna Restorations.  DSP and PDD kits are installed conjunctively via Alteration Installation Team (AIT) and can be accomplished outside of a CNO Availability.

[P40A / BR830 AN/SPQ-9B PRODUCTION SUPPORT]: Provides support for production of hardware and hardware components and is composed primarily of Warfare Center Activity support, Software Support Activity (SSA), Integrated Logistics Agent (ILA), Acquisition Engineering Agent (AEA), Technical Design Agent (TDA) and Professional Support Services (PSS). Also includes support for cybersecurity compliance and software certification.

[P3A / BR040 AN/SPQ-9B RADAR FMP EQUIPMENT]: Procures AN/SPQ-9B Radars to add Anti-Ship Missile Defense (ASMD) capability to Shipboard Combat Systems. Procures radars to support combat systems on the following ship classes: CG, LHA, DDG, CVN, LHD, LPD, U.S. Coast Guard National Security Cutter and a Training Unit. Systems procured for Cruisers/Destroyers (CRUDES) and Amphibious Ships in FY14 and beyond include the Periscope Detection and Discrimination (PDD) capability.

Name.@footnote: 1) Due to funding reductions in FY21 only one AN/SPQ-9B system will be procured vice two systems. This allowed for acceleration of additional DSP and PDD kits in FY21 to eliminate obsolete components from fielded systems to ensure long-term supportability and spares availability. Funding for PDD installations increased in FY22 accordingly due to the additional PDD kits being procured in FY21.  2) Miscellaneous ECPs primarily funds product improvements, corrects problems reported by Fleet units, upgrades unreliable components, replaces obsolete components/parts no longer in production, and addresses supportability concerns.

Name.val: 2.3) BR042 DIGITAL SIGNAL PROCESSOR KITS - PROCUREMENTS
2.4) BR042 DIGITAL SIGNAL PROCESSOR KITS - INSTALLS

Name.@footnote: AN/SPQ-9B Production Support provides support for production of hardware and production of hardware components and is composed primarily of Warfare Center Activity support, Software Support Activity (SSA), Integrated Logistics Agent (ILA), Acquisition Engineering Agent (AEA), Technical Design Agent (TDA) and Professional Support Services (PSS). Also includes support for cybersecurity compliance packages in the enterprise mission assurance support service (eMASS), element, and combat system certifications.

1) The plan was to procure two AN/SPQ-9B systems in FY21. Due to funding reductions in FY21, only one system will be procured vice two. As a result, FY21-FY22 installation costs were also reduced to reflect only one system being installed vice two.  2) SPQ-9B was moved from BLI 5110 to BLI 2026 in FY2004.  Prior to 2004, the procurement of the first five AN/SPQ-9B systems was funded under the Mk 86 program under BLI 5110. The installation costs for four out of five of these installs were included in the 2026 budget.  This explains the difference of 81 installations and only 77 procurements in this budget (delta 4).    3) AN/SPQ-9B systems are installed using Alteration Installation Teams (AITs) that customarily require funding for planning yard Design Services Allocation (DSA) up to two years prior to the year of installation and funding for Advanced Planning (AP) one year prior to installation, to support individual ship class drawing packages, ship checks and long lead material unique to the installation in order to maintain alignment with ship availability schedules.
Name.val: 1.1.1) BR040 AN/SPQ-9B RADAR FMP EQUIPMENT - NonOrganic

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: BR040 AN/SPQ-9B RADAR FMP EQUIPMENT

Description.val:
[BR040 AN/SPQ-9B RADAR FMP EQUIPMENT] Procures AN/SPQ-9B Radars to add Anti-Ship Missile Defense (ASMD) capability to Shipboard Combat Systems. Procures radars to support combat systems on the following ship classes: CG, LHA, DDG, CVN, LHD, LPD, U.S. Coast Guard National Security Cutter and a Training Unit. Systems procured for Cruisers/Destroyer (CRUDES) and Amphibious Ships in FY14 and beyond also include the Periscope Detection and Discrimination (PDD) capability. 

Notes: BR040 AN/SPQ-9B RADAR FMP EQUIPMENT:

1) SPQ-9B was moved from BLI 5110 to BLI 2026 in FY2004.  Prior to 2004, the procurement of the first five AN/SPQ-9B systems was funded under the Mk 86 program under BLI 5110. The installation costs for four out of five of these installs were included in the 2026 budget.  This explains the difference of 81 installations and only 77 procurements in this budget (delta 4).  

2) AN/SPQ-9B systems are installed using Alteration Installation Teams (AITs) that customarily require funding for planning yard Design Services Allocation (DSA) up to two years prior to the year of installation and funding for Advanced Planning (AP) one year prior to installation, to support individual ship class drawing packages, ship checks and long lead material unique to the installation in order to maintain alignment with ship availability schedules.
